column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 104 of 124”
Table: 96
Capital Improvement Plan
Contingency List
DESCRIPTION
This project is for a study to improve drainage of Pocahontas
Place and design a system to handle the street water runoff.
Improve the drainage system at the intersection of Todds
Lane and Big Bethel Road to prevent flooding during heavy
rain events.
In accordance with the Mary Peake Watershed Study,
funding is requested to complete "Scenario 3a" of the study.
The work will be done by "in-house" forces to pipe an existing
open ditch that is narrow, difficult to maintain and in need of
increased capacity.
The Wythe/I664 Drainage Improvement Study was completed
in 2003. A major outfall was installed along with the
upstream detention pond, located at Pembroke and Kentucky
Avenues. The final phase of the improvements calls for
improving the upstream neighborhoods with piping the
existing drainage ditches.
TOTAL: Neighborhood Support
Construction of a state-of-the-art 20,000 square foot, full-
service branch library with increased space for collection
display, public computing, individual study, group study,
tutoring, programming and public meetings.
Construction of a major sewage pumping station in the vicinity
of Interstate 64/Pine Chapel Road to serve future
development in the Crossroads area, redevelopment of the
Bluebird Gap Farm area, and to eliminate one or more
existing sewage pumping stations.
Construction of a parking garage and connecting street
extending Syms Street to King Street to facilitate increased
connectivity across the site.
